text:
HUGGY RAO: Think of
all the time that's
wasted in your organization.

BOB SUTTON: How do
I get inspiration?

HUGGY RAO: How do you
identify an orphan problem?

BOB SUTTON: How do we
get going when I'm stuck?
HUGGY RAO: I'm Huggy Rao.
BOB SUTTON: And I'm Bob Sutton.

HUGGY RAO: And we
are [BEEP] Fixers!

Brought to you by
Stanford Online.

BOB SUTTON: We're going to
have a series of conversations

with people who are
smart, entertaining,

and good at fixing
problems in organizations.

HUGGY RAO: We have them
in different industries,

regulated versus unregulated,
because fixing [BEEP]
isn't the same everywhere.

A very reasonable question
for all of you to ask

is, why do I need to listen
to these conversations?

How is it actually
going to help me?

BOB SUTTON: First
of all, anybody

can play a constructive
role in [BEEP] fixing.

You're going to learn
what [BEEP] fixers do.

People who know how to
make the right things easy,

the wrong things hard,
and do it without driving
other people crazy.

HUGGY RAO: What questions
might we ask guest
to get our conversation going?

BOB SUTTON: How do you spot
which [BEEP] is worth battling,
and which you can't fix for now?

HUGGY RAO: How do
you distinguish
between SNAFU and FUBAR?
BOB SUTTON: When can you fix it?

When is it time just
to exit scene, right?

HUGGY RAO: How do you decide
who do you want to help,
and how and why?

BOB SUTTON:
Certainly we're going

to ask them some of their
favorite messes that they've

cleaned up, and
some [BEEP] they've

created that other
people had to clean up,
because we all do that in life.

HUGGY RAO: You're suggesting a
fascinating hypothesis, which

is [BEEP] is actually
created at the top
and falls out at the bottom.

BOB SUTTON: Yeah, I don't
think that's a new hypothesis.

The question is,
who cleans it up?
HUGGY RAO: Uh-huh.

They're really part
of the immune system
for the organization.
BOB SUTTON: Oh, I love that.

So Huggy, you think the
Stanford administrators

are going to let us use
the term [BEEP] Fixers?

HUGGY RAO: Maybe we should just
call it Send Help In Trouble.
BOB SUTTON: That's good.
I like that.
That's good.

HUGGY RAO: Because
[BEEP] is an acronym.
BOB SUTTON: Yeah, I got that.

HUGGY RAO: Now, we got to go
and fix some [BEEP] right away,
Bob.
BOB SUTTON: That's our job.
Let's go.
HUGGY RAO: Right.
[MUSIC PLAYING]
